message.content:
cs.NE, cs.DC, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CE

This paper is likely to belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category as it deals with the simulation of spiking neural networks. It could also belong to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) sub-category as the simulation is distributed across multiple hardware cores and nodes. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of MPI processes, which is commonly used in distributed computing. The paper also discusses the implications of longer-range intra-areal connectivity, which could fall under the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The use of a cluster of IBM NX360 M5 16-core compute nodes and InfiniBand network could also place this paper in the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the memory occupation and scaling of the simulation, which could fall under the cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) sub-category.
